metadata.case_name: State of Bihar v. Rambalak Singh

facts.text: Rambalak Singh detained under Rule 30 of the Defence of India Rules.
Habeas corpus petition filed on behalf of detenu Rambalak Singh under Art. 226 of the Constitution in Patna High Court.

Patna High Court ordered release of detenu Rambalak Singh on bail of Rs. 500 with two sureties of Rs. 250 each to the satisfaction of the Registrar; Mr. Girish Nandan Sinha gave undertaking that detenu will not indulge in any prejudicial activity or commit any prejudicial act during pendency.
State of Bihar filed appeal by special leave to Supreme Court against High Court order.

legal_issues.text: Whether the High Court has jurisdiction under Art. 226 to release a detenu on bail pending final disposal of habeas corpus petition challenging detention under Rule 30 of the Defence of India Rules.

petitioner_arguments.text: High Court order releasing detenu on bail is without jurisdiction due to policy and object of Defence of India Rules and Rule 30; detention to prevent prejudicial activities affecting defence of India, public safety etc.; distinguishes from other habeas corpus cases; bail not interim but final as detention has no fixed period.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 30 of Defence of India Rules; Art. 226 of Constitution

petitioner_arguments.text: Principle from Special Reference No. 1 of 1964 does not apply to detentions under Rule 30 due to special considerations of preventive detention.

respondent_arguments.text: High Court has jurisdiction to grant interim bail in habeas corpus proceedings under Art. 226, analogous to other cases.

court_reasoning.text: High Court has jurisdiction under Art. 226 to grant interim bail as auxiliary to main relief of release if detention order invalid; principle from Special Reference applies equally; interim relief in aid of final relief.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Jurisdiction conferred implies power for essential acts including interim orders.

court_reasoning.text: Exercise of jurisdiction circumscribed by special considerations of preventive detention under Rule 30; narrow scope of judicial review (e.g., mala fides, facial invalidity); prefer expedited hearing over interim bail; unwise bail may harm public interest.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Distinction between existence of jurisdiction and its proper exercise.

court_reasoning.text: Not deciding propriety, reasonableness or validity of the specific bail order; appellant sought only decision on jurisdiction.

holdings.text: High Court has jurisdiction to grant bail pending habeas corpus under Art. 226 challenging detention under Rule 30, but exercise circumscribed by considerations relevant to preventive detention.

precedents_cited.relevance: High Court jurisdiction to grant interim bail in habeas corpus not exceeded; applies analogously to Rule 30 detentions.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Orissa v. Madan Gopal Rungta
precedents_cited.relevance: Interim relief granted only in aid of and auxiliary to main relief.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Confers jurisdiction on High Court for habeas corpus; includes power for interim orders.

statutes_cited.name: Defence of India Rules
statutes_cited.relevance: Authorizes preventive detention to prevent prejudicial activities; special considerations limit interim bail exercise.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Mentioned in context of habeas corpus proceedings in Special Reference.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court holds that Patna High Court had jurisdiction to grant interim bail to detenu pending habeas corpus petition; does not examine propriety or reasonableness of the order as appellant sought only jurisdictional clarification; order stands.
outcome.relief_granted: Jurisdiction affirmed; bail order not interfered with.

key_quotes.text: "if jurisdiction is conferred by a statute upon a Court, the conferment of jurisdiction implies the conferment of the power of doing all such acts, or employing such means, as are essentially necessary to its execution."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Basis for holding interim bail within jurisdiction.

key_quotes.text: "the High Court has jurisdiction to grant bail, but the exercise of the said jurisdiction is inevitably circumscribed by the considerations which are special to such proceedings."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding balancing jurisdiction with limitations.

key_quotes.text: "We do not propose to consider the question as to whether the order under appeal is proper, reasonable or valid."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Limits scope of appeal to jurisdiction only.
